thread.title: Dismissed Syracuse football player Ashton Broyld joins DT Wayne Williams at West Georgia
thread.title_full: Dismissed Syracuse football player Ashton Broyld joins DT Wayne Williams at West Georgia | syracuse.com

author: Stephen Bailey | sbailey@syracuse.com
title: Dismissed Syracuse football player Ashton Broyld joins DT Wayne Williams at West Georgia
text:
Syracuse, N.Y. â€” Former Syracuse football player Ashton Broyld has resurfaced at West Georgia after being dismissed from SU for a violation of team rules in late July.
Defensive tackle Wayne Williams, who previously announced his move on Facebook, also transferred to WGU.
SU head coach Scott Shafer mentioned both players during his Thursday press conference.
Broyld, a senior, played quarterback, running back, wide receiver (slot and outside) and hybrid for the Orange, unable to settle into a position and contribute regularly.
He finished his Syracuse career with 862 all-purpose yards and one touchdown in 25 games played. Broyld led the Orange in receiving in 2013 before a lower-body injury kept him out of eight games last year. He was set to join Ervin Philips and Ben Lewis as the team's primary hybrids.
Broyld came to Syracuse from Milford Academy as a quarterback. The Rochester native was named the 2010 New York State Class AA Player of the Year after leading Rush-Henrietta to the state championship and a 13-0 record.
He's caught three passes for 25 yards in four games played at West Georgia.
Williams, a senior, also split ways with the program this offseason.
He came to SU after two years at ASA College in Brooklyn and dealt with work ethic and weight issues during his brief stint with the Orange. Williams recorded nine tackles and a fumble recovery in five games played last season.
He has six tackles and a quarterback hit in two games played for West Georgia.
